channel.title: Using "\\" to Define File Paths is OS Specific?
channel.description:
I recently switched to Ubuntu Linux and when I booted up some java programs I had made on Windows I was getting errors referencing file paths with "\\" instead of "/" which turned out to be the fix. I'm wondering if it's just my install or if it really is an OS specific thing?
Discuss.

item.title: Using "\\" to Define File Paths is OS Specific?

[/quote]
…what

why does me calling you a moron mean that i am offended?[/quote]
He’s an idiot, why bother.

Lol. At my school they didn’t enable anything, lol. You can even write/delete/edit on the harddrives on the computers. O_o

Exactly like my school. Their security just keeps getting better as I start to understand more about their system and how to exploit it. If I knew this much back in year 7 I could take the whole network down.

Omg, go for FBI next.
[/quote]
I didn’t intend to sound like that. Maybe a perfect forum would be one where nobody expresses any sort of opinion?[/quote]
you are a moron

item.title: Using "\\" to Define File Paths is OS Specific?
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

In the command prompt/batch files you would use “/”, not “” because it would just say

'____' is not recognized as an operable program or batch file.

Sometimes you would use a combination of “/” and “”:

C://Documents and Settings/Desktop/Porn\500some.wma

Read full topic

item.title: Using "\\" to Define File Paths is OS Specific?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“quest rs, post:10, topic:202351”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=267072.msg2207284#msg2207284 date=1209697031]

Mopman I cant recall a time where windows has rejected /… or \

in compiling I have to use \ but in my java programs \ and / both work

‘\’ is really only ‘’ because you need to escape it.
[/quote]

I know that :), I was telling mopman that it doesn’t matter? Because java can treat your path as a url or so.

Just curious mop, when would it not work?
(Need to know for general knowledge because my sumative is due in 2 months and it involves file reading and downloading, just to avoid the “sometimes” not working condition in case of some error.)

[size=8pt]and sorry if my tone sounds like a in your face kind of thing, i’m no java expert, and my communication skills are a bit weak so please do treat this as any normal post.[/size][/quote]
Who cares why, just use ‘/’ and you are fine.

Read full topic

in compiling I have to use \ but in my java programs \ and / both work
[/quote]
‘\’ is really only ‘’ because you need to escape it.[/quote]

I know that :), I was telling mopman that it doesn’t matter? Because java can treat your path as a url or so.

Just curious mop, when would it not work?
(Need to know for general knowledge because my sumative is due in 2 months and it involves file reading and downloading, just to avoid the “sometimes” not working condition in case of some error.)

[size=8pt]and sorry if my tone sounds like a in your face kind of thing, i’m no java expert, and my communication skills are a bit weak so please do treat this as any normal post.[/size]
